text: I think there's a healthy aspect to this
nostalgia in one sense because it is
bringing the digital age into
perspective a little bit I've noticed
that younger people in talking to people
say under 40 about my book I've noticed
there's this interesting uprising
upwelling of nostalgia for the analog
era you know younger people seem to be
into vinyl records and all these things
that I used to think of as artifacts but
they really seem to be making a comeback
and I think that's nice because it sort
of is bringing together past and present
into a new um a kind of a new Confluence
or a new um a hole you know it seemed
like we had almost Left Behind the past
and stepped into this new space and we
were never going to look back but you
know reality isn't really like that the
past always feeds into the present and
the present continues to learn from the
past and I think that's what's happening
now we're in this kind of adjustment
period but I do think there's also a an
inevitable
danger to Too Much Nostalgia and to
feeling that um oh gosh it's gotten
scary now and we can't handle this
anymore you know one of the lessons I
learned in my look back at history is
the people who think we're kind of at
the end of civilization we're about to
enter a new dark age because of the
technology that's risen up and
threatened our sanity they're always
wrong you know they always turn out to
be wrong they're basically I mean I
understand the anxiety because
adjustment can be hard but in the end
when you look back they were basically
fearmongers
and they didn't see they didn't
understand the great capacity of human
beings not just to adjust but to be
resourceful and to figure out the new
places that technology can take us if we
make the best use of it fortunately most
people are not in that category most
people are I think at bottom when it
comes to newness and technological um
Evolution most people are optimists you
can see it on the street you know
everybody's having great fun with these
devices sometimes to a fault sometimes
going overboard which is one of my
points but I think we are ultimately on
the right path and um we will get to a
better place with these gadgets
